365.quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
365.author: Winston Churchill

366.quote: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
366.author: Lao Tzu

367.quote: You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.'
367.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

368.quote: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma - which is living with the results of other people's thinking. Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most important, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition.
368.author: Steve Jobs

369.quote: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
369.author: Nelson Mandela

370.quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
370.author: Walt Disney

371.quote: We don't develop courage by being happy every day. We develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.
371.author: Barbara De Angelis

372.quote: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
372.author: Bruce Lee

373.quote: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life.
373.author: Marcus Garvey

374.quote: You may not always have a comfortable life and you will not always be able to solve all of the world's problems at once but don't ever underestimate the importance you can have because history has shown us that courage can be contagious and hope can take on a life of its own.
374.author: Michelle Obama

375.quote: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
375.author: Winston Churchill

376.quote: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.
376.author: Muhammad Ali

377.quote: Goodness is about character - integrity, honesty, kindness, generosity, moral courage, and the like. More than anything else, it is about how we treat other people.
377.author: Dennis Prager

378.quote: America was not built on fear. America was built on courage, on imagination and an unbeatable determination to do the job at hand.
378.author: Harry S Truman

379.quote: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
379.author: T. S. Eliot

380.quote: Life is the most exciting opportunity we have. But we have one shot. You graduate from college once, and that's it. You're going out of that nest. And you have to find that courage that's deep, deep, deep in there. Every step of the way.
380.author: Andrew Shue

381.quote: Courage, sacrifice, determination, commitment, toughness, heart, talent, guts. That's what little girls are made of.
381.author: Bethany Hamilton

382.quote: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear, not absence of fear.
382.author: Mark Twain

383.quote: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
383.author: Robert Green Ingersoll

384.quote: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.
384.author: Earl Nightingale

385.quote: Heroes represent the best of ourselves, respecting that we are human beings. A hero can be anyone from Gandhi to your classroom teacher, anyone who can show courage when faced with a problem. A hero is someone who is willing to help others in his or her best capacity.
385.author: Ricky Martin

386.quote: Courage is being scared to death... and saddling up anyway.
386.author: John Wayne

387.quote: There can be no failure to a man who has not lost his courage, his character, his self respect, or his self-confidence. He is still a King.
387.author: Orison Swett Marden

388.quote: Take chances, make mistakes. That's how you grow. Pain nourishes your courage. You have to fail in order to practice being brave.
388.author: Mary Tyler Moore

389.quote: Failure is unimportant. It takes courage to make a fool of yourself.
389.author: Charlie Chaplin

390.quote: It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.
390.author: J. K. Rowling

391.quote: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.
391.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

392.quote: A grateful heart is a beginning of greatness. It is an expression of humility. It is a foundation for the development of such virtues as prayer, faith, courage, contentment, happiness, love, and well-being.
392.author: James E. Faust

393.quote: Have the courage to say no. Have the courage to face the truth. Do the right thing because it is right. These are the magic keys to living your life with integrity.
393.author: W. Clement Stone

394.quote: Don't Make Assumptions. Find the courage to ask questions and to express what you really want. Communicate with others as clearly as you can to avoid misunderstandings, sadness and drama. With just this one agreement, you can completely transform your life.
394.author: Don Miguel Ruiz

395.quote: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.
395.author: John Wooden

396.quote: Jump, and you will find out how to unfold your wings as you fall.
396.author: Ray Bradbury

397.quote: Loyalty and devotion lead to bravery. Bravery leads to the spirit of self-sacrifice. The spirit of self-sacrifice creates trust in the power of love.
397.author: Morihei Ueshiba

399.quote: Efforts and courage are not enough without purpose and direction.
399.author: John F. Kennedy

400.quote: Let us not pray to be sheltered from dangers but to be fearless when facing them.
400.author: Rabindranath Tagore

401.quote: We must become bigger than we have been: more courageous, greater in spirit, larger in outlook. We must become members of a new race, overcoming petty prejudice, owing our ultimate allegiance not to nations but to our fellow men within the human community.
401.author: Haile Selassie

402.quote: Either you decide to stay in the shallow end of the pool or you go out in the ocean.
402.author: Christopher Reeve

403.quote: My great hope is to laugh as much as I cry; to get my work done and try to love somebody and have the courage to accept the love in return.
403.author: Maya Angelou

404.quote: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.
404.author: Coco Chanel

405.quote: One isn't necessarily born with courage, but one is born with potential. Without courage, we cannot practice any other virtue with consistency. We can't be kind, true, merciful, generous, or honest.
405.author: Maya Angelou

406.quote: Courageous people do not fear forgiving, for the sake of peace.
406.author: Nelson Mandela

407.quote: He is a man of courage who does not run away, but remains at his post and fights against the enemy.
407.author: Socrates

408.quote: I think we judge talent wrong. What do we see as talent? I think I have made the same mistake myself. We judge talent by people's ability to strike a cricket ball. The sweetness, the timing. That's the only thing we see as talent. Things like determination, courage, discipline, temperament, these are also talent.
408.author: Rahul Dravid

409.quote: Success is not measured by what you accomplish, but by the opposition you have encountered, and the courage with which you have maintained the struggle against overwhelming odds.
409.author: Orison Swett Marden

410.quote: The greatest obstacle to being heroic is the doubt whether one may not be going to prove one's self a fool; the truest heroism is to resist the doubt; and the profoundest wisdom, to know when it ought to be resisted, and when it be obeyed.
410.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

411.quote: It is only through labor and painful effort, by grim energy and resolute courage, that we move on to better things.
411.author: Theodore Roosevelt

412.quote: A team is where a boy can prove his courage on his own. A gang is where a coward goes to hide.
412.author: Mickey Mantle

413.quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
413.author: Andre Gide

414.quote: Earth teach me to forget myself as melted snow forgets its life. Earth teach me resignation as the leaves which die in the fall. Earth teach me courage as the tree which stands all alone. Earth teach me regeneration as the seed which rises in the spring.
414.author: William Alexander

415.quote: Courtesy is as much a mark of a gentleman as courage.
415.author: Theodore Roosevelt

416.quote: Values are principles and ideas that bring meaning to the seemingly mundane experience of life. A meaningful life that ultimately brings happiness and pride requires you to respond to temptations as well as challenges with honor, dignity, and courage.
416.author: Laura Schlessinger

418.quote: It is only necessary to have courage, for strength without self-confidence is useless.
418.author: Giacomo Casanova

419.quote: The terrorists thought they would change my aims and stop my ambitions, but nothing changed in my life except this: weakness, fear and hopelessness died. Strength, power and courage were born.
419.author: Malala Yousafzai

420.quote: Often the difference between a successful man and a failure is not one's better abilities or ideas, but the courage that one has to bet on his ideas, to take a calculated risk, and to act.
420.author: Maxwell Maltz

421.quote: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.
421.author: e. e. cummings

422.quote: Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees the others.
422.author: Aristotle

423.quote: The first virtue in a soldier is endurance of fatigue; courage is only the second virtue.
423.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

424.quote: Courage is never to let your actions be influenced by your fears.
424.author: Arthur Koestler

425.quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
425.author: Anais Nin

426.quote: Courage is fire, and bullying is smoke.
426.author: Benjamin Disraeli

427.quote: Inaction breeds doubt and fear. Action breeds confidence and courage. If you want to conquer fear, do not sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.
427.author: Dale Carnegie

428.quote: Creativity requires the courage to let go of certainties.
428.author: Erich Fromm

429.quote: We must build dikes of courage to hold back the flood of fear.
429.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

430.quote: Courage is the most important of all the virtues, because without courage you can't practice any other virtue consistently. You can practice any virtue erratically, but nothing consistently without courage.
430.author: Maya Angelou

431.quote: Have courage for the great sorrows of life and patience for the small ones; and when you have laboriously accomplished your daily task, go to sleep in peace.
431.author: Victor Hugo

432.quote: The best protection any woman can have... is courage.
432.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

433.quote: To create one's world in any of the arts takes courage.
433.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

434.quote: It takes a lot of courage to release the familiar and seemingly secure, to embrace the new. But there is no real security in what is no longer meaningful. There is more security in the adventurous and exciting, for in movement there is life, and in change there is power.
434.author: Alan Cohen

435.quote: Hope lies in dreams, in imagination, and in the courage of those who dare to make dreams into reality.
435.author: Jonas Salk

436.quote: We've let the blade of our innocence dull over time, and it's only in innocence that you find any kind of magic, any kind of courage.
436.author: Sean Penn

437.quote: One individual can begin a movement that turns the tide of history. Martin Luther King in the civil rights movement, Mohandas Ganhi in India, Nelson Mandela in South Africa are examples of people standing up with courage and non-violence to bring about needed changes.
437.author: Jack Canfield

438.quote: One man scorned and covered with scars still strove with his last ounce of courage to reach the unreachable stars; and the world will be better for this.
438.author: Miguel de Cervantes

439.quote: To see what is right and not to do it is want of courage, or of principle.
439.author: Confucius

440.quote: Greatness, in the last analysis, is largely bravery - courage in escaping from old ideas and old standards and respectable ways of doing things.
440.author: James Harvey Robinson

441.quote: Vulnerability is the essence of romance. It's the art of being uncalculated, the willingness to look foolish, the courage to say, 'This is me, and I'm interested in you enough to show you my flaws with the hope that you may embrace me for all that I am but, more important, all that I am not.'
441.author: Ashton Kutcher

442.quote: When we tackle obstacles, we find hidden reserves of courage and resilience we did not know we had. And it is only when we are faced with failure do we realise that these resources were always there within us. We only need to find them and move on with our lives.
442.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

443.quote: During the long process of history, by relying on our own diligence, courage and wisdom, Chinese people have opened up a good and beautiful home where all ethnic groups live in harmony and fostered an excellent culture that never fades.
443.author: Xi Jinping

444.quote: Courage is contagious. When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are often stiffened.
444.author: Billy Graham

445.quote: The eagle has no fear of adversity. We need to be like the eagle and have a fearless spirit of a conqueror!
445.author: Joyce Meyer

446.quote: If human beings had genuine courage, they'd wear their costumes every day of the year, not just on Halloween.
446.author: Douglas Coupland

447.quote: Change will never happen when people lack the ability and courage to see themselves for who they are.
447.author: Bryant H. McGill

448.quote: Courage is the ladder on which all the other virtues mount.
448.author: Clare Boothe Luce

449.quote: Courage is being afraid but going on anyhow.
449.author: Dan Rather

450.quote: Courage is doing what you are afraid to do. There can be no courage unless you are scared.
450.author: Eddie Rickenbacker

451.quote: Courage is the capacity to confront what can be imagined.
451.author: Leo Rosten

452.quote: The only courage that matters is the kind that gets you from one moment to the next.
452.author: Mignon McLaughlin

453.quote: The courage to be is the courage to accept oneself, in spite of being unacceptable.
453.author: Paul Tillich

454.quote: Courage is a kind of salvation.
454.author: Plato

456.quote: The trials on the road to world harmony are no greater than the courage of those who accept the challenge.
456.author: Carl Lewis

457.quote: You have to really be courageous about your instincts and your ideas. Otherwise you'll just knuckle under, and things that might have been memorable will be lost.
457.author: Francis Ford Coppola

458.quote: The weak in courage is strong in cunning.
458.author: William Blake

459.quote: Presumption should never make us neglect that which appears easy to us, nor despair make us lose courage at the sight of difficulties.
459.author: Benjamin Banneker

460.quote: Success is that old ABC - ability, breaks, and courage.
460.author: Charles Luckman

461.quote: Do you really think it is weakness that yields to temptation? I tell you that there are terrible temptations which it requires strength, strength and courage to yield to.
461.author: Oscar Wilde

462.quote: Those who won our independence... valued liberty as an end and as a means. They believed liberty to be the secret of happiness and courage to be the secret of liberty.
462.author: Louis D. Brandeis

463.quote: Courage means to keep working a relationship, to continue seeking solutions to difficult problems, and to stay focused during stressful periods.
463.author: Denis Waitley

464.quote: The only reason I'm in Hollywood is that I don't have the moral courage to refuse the money.
464.author: Marlon Brando

465.quote: Unless a reviewer has the courage to give you unqualified praise, I say ignore the bastard.
465.author: John Steinbeck

466.quote: A man of courage is also full of faith.
466.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

467.quote: Physical courage, which despises all danger, will make a man brave in one way; and moral courage, which despises all opinion, will make a man brave in another.
467.author: Charles Caleb Colton

468.quote: The strangest, most generous, and proudest of all virtues is true courage.
468.author: Michel de Montaigne

469.quote: There is a measure needing courage to adopt and enforce it, which I believe to be of virtue sufficient to redeem the nation in this its darkest hour: one only; I know of no other to which we may rationally trust for relief from impending dangers without and within.
469.author: Robert Dale Owen

470.quote: An able, disinterested, public-spirited press, with trained intelligence to know the right and courage to do it, can preserve that public virtue without which popular government is a sham and a mockery.
470.author: Joseph Pulitzer

471.quote: Nothing gives us courage more readily than the desire to avoid looking like a damn fool.
471.author: Dean Koontz

472.quote: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.
472.author: Confucius

473.quote: Courage consists not in hazarding without fear; but being resolutely minded in a just cause.
473.author: Plutarch

474.quote: Love is the most difficult and dangerous form of courage. Courage is the most desperate, admirable and noble kind of love.
474.author: Delmore Schwartz

475.quote: My mother taught me about the power of inspiration and courage, and she did it with a strength and a passion that I wish could be bottled.
475.author: Carly Fiorina

476.quote: There are pretenders to piety as well as to courage.
476.author: Moliere

477.quote: So the brother in black offers to these United States the source of courage that endures, and laughter.
477.author: Zora Neale Hurston

478.quote: It's not just Bin Laden or just those that are involved in the counterterrorism effort. We've gotta cast the net broader than that. But I think it's a - very special tribute that we all owe to the bravery and courage of the men and women in the intelligence and military business who performed so well to finally get it done.
478.author: Dick Cheney

479.quote: One of the greatest gifts my father gave me - unintentionally - was witnessing the courage with which he bore adversity. We had a bit of a rollercoaster life with some really challenging financial periods. He was always unshaken, completely tranquil, the same ebullient, laughing, jovial man.
479.author: Ben Okri

480.quote: It took me realizing that a broken heart has never actually killed anyone to find the courage to ask for what I want, in just about every situation. That was part of my own growing up.
480.author: Ginnifer Goodwin

481.quote: I have written a memoir here and there, and that takes its own form of selfishness and courage. However, generally speaking, I have no interest in writing about my own life or intruding in the privacy of those around me.
481.author: Peter Carey

482.quote: If one suffers we all suffer. Togetherness is strength. Courage.
482.author: Jean-Bertrand Aristide

483.quote: When you have a wife who has been a tower of strength and shown more courage than you dreamed existed - that's the finest I know.
483.author: Lou Gehrig

484.quote: Competing at the highest level is not about winning. It's about preparation, courage, understanding and nurturing your people, and heart. Winning is the result.
484.author: Joe Torre

485.quote: You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
485.author: Aristotle

486.quote: Courage is not simply one of the virtues, but the form of every virtue at the testing point.
486.author: C. S. Lewis

487.quote: Faced with what is right, to leave it undone shows a lack of courage.
487.author: Confucius

488.quote: If you could get up the courage to begin, you have the courage to succeed.
488.author: David Viscott

489.quote: It requires greater courage to preserve inner freedom, to move on in one's inward journey into new realms, than to stand defiantly for outer freedom. It is often easier to play the martyr, as it is to be rash in battle.
489.author: Rollo May

490.quote: Courage is not the absence of despair; it is, rather, the capacity to move ahead in spite of despair.
490.author: Rollo May

491.quote: The opposite of courage in our society is not cowardice, it is conformity.
491.author: Rollo May

492.quote: Bravery is the capacity to perform properly even when scared half to death.
492.author: Omar N. Bradley

493.quote: The only service a friend can really render is to keep up your courage by holding up to you a mirror in which you can see a noble image of yourself.
493.author: George Bernard Shaw

494.quote: Courage is found in unlikely places.
494.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

495.quote: If you are lucky enough to find a way of life you love, you have to find the courage to live it.
495.author: John Irving

497.quote: I know of no higher fortitude than stubborness in the face of overwhelming odds.
497.author: Louis Nizer

498.quote: He who is brave is free.
498.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

499.quote: We must have courage to bet on our ideas, to take the calculated risk, and to act. Everyday living requires courage if life is to be effective and bring happiness.
499.author: Maxwell Maltz

500.quote: Valor lies just halfway between rashness and cowardice.
500.author: Miguel de Cervantes

501.quote: I have a lot of things to prove to myself. One is that I can live my life fearlessly.
501.author: Oprah Winfrey

502.quote: Happy are those who dare courageously to defend what they love.
502.author: Ovid

503.quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
503.author: Plato

504.quote: God, give us grace to accept with serenity the things that cannot be changed, courage to change the things which should be changed and the wisdom to distinguish the one from the other.
504.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

505.quote: There are no easy answers, but there are simple answers. We must have the courage to do what we know is morally right.
505.author: Ronald Reagan

506.quote: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?
506.author: Vincent Van Gogh

507.quote: Who could refrain that had a heart to love and in that heart courage to make love known?
507.author: William Shakespeare

508.quote: The secret to happiness is freedom... And the secret to freedom is courage.
508.author: Thucydides

509.quote: Love bravely, live bravely, be courageous, there's really nothing to lose. There's no wrong you can't make right again, so be kinder to yourself, you know, have fun, take chances. There's no bounds.
509.author: Jewel

510.quote: We have a powerful potential in out youth, and we must have the courage to change old ideas and practices so that we may direct their power toward good ends.
510.author: Mary McLeod Bethune

511.quote: Courage, above all things, is the first quality of a warrior.
511.author: Carl von Clausewitz

512.quote: Courage is a special kind of knowledge: the knowledge of how to fear what ought to be feared and how not to fear what ought not to be feared.
512.author: David Ben-Gurion

513.quote: I'm grateful to God for His bountiful gifts... He gave me courage and faith in myself.
513.author: Loretta Young

514.quote: Always be courageous and strong, and don't fear.
514.author: Gabby Douglas

515.quote: There are a group of people who would like to silence everybody and have everybody go along to get along, but that's not going to be very helpful for us in the long run, in terms of solving our problems. And somebody has to be courageous enough to actually stand up to, you know, the bullies.
515.author: Ben Carson

516.quote: Fearlessness is not only possible, it is the ultimate joy. When you touch nonfear, you are free.
516.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

517.quote: People say to me all the time, 'You have no fear.' I tell them, 'No, that's not true. I'm scared all the time. You have to have fear in order to have courage. I'm a courageous person because I'm a scared person.'
517.author: Ronda Rousey

518.quote: You have to accept whatever comes and the only important thing is that you meet it with courage and with the best that you have to give.
518.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

519.quote: History, despite its wrenching pain, cannot be unlived, but if faced with courage, need not be lived again.
519.author: Maya Angelou

520.quote: The criteria for serving one's country should be competence, courage and willingness to serve. When we deny people the chance to serve because of their sexual orientation, we deprive them of their rights of citizenship, and we deprive our armed forces the service of willing and capable Americans.
520.author: Dianne Feinstein

521.quote: I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naive or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman.
521.author: Anais Nin

522.quote: Most of us have far more courage than we ever dreamed we possessed.
522.author: Dale Carnegie

523.quote: Let us go forth with fear and courage and rage to save the world.
523.author: Grace Paley

524.quote: Courage, my friends; 'tis not too late to build a better world.
524.author: Tommy Douglas

525.quote: Optimism is the foundation of courage.
525.author: Nicholas M. Butler

526.quote: I saw courage both in the Vietnam War and in the struggle to stop it. I learned that patriotism includes protest, not just military service.
526.author: John F. Kerry

527.quote: The valor and courage of our young women and men in the armed services are a shining example to all of the world, and we owe them and their families our deepest respect.
527.author: Bill Frist

528.quote: None speak of the bravery, the might, or the intellect of Jesus; but the devil is always imagined as a being of acute intellect, political cunning, and the fiercest courage. These universal and instinctive tendencies of the human mind reveal much.
528.author: Lydia M. Child

529.quote: My mother taught me that we all have the power to achieve our dreams. What I lacked was the courage.
529.author: Clay Aiken

530.quote: There never is a good time for tough decisions. There will always be an election or something else. You have to pick courage and do it. Governance is about taking tough, even unpopular, decisions.
530.author: Jairam Ramesh

531.quote: It is curious that physical courage should be so common in the world and moral courage so rare.
531.author: Mark Twain

532.quote: Why should we honour those that die upon the field of battle? A man may show as reckless a courage in entering into the abyss of himself.
532.author: William Butler Yeats

533.quote: In the Soviet army it takes more courage to retreat than advance.
533.author: Joseph Stalin

534.quote: Each of us has an inner dream that we can unfold if we will just have the courage to admit what it is. And the faith to trust our own admission. The admitting is often very difficult.
534.author: Julia Cameron

535.quote: Courage is like love; it must have hope for nourishment.
535.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

536.quote: He who loses wealth loses much; he who loses a friend loses more; but he that loses his courage loses all.
536.author: Miguel de Cervantes

537.quote: Healing takes courage, and we all have courage, even if we have to dig a little to find it.
537.author: Tori Amos

538.quote: The principal act of courage is to endure and withstand dangers doggedly rather than to attack them.
538.author: Thomas Aquinas

539.quote: Soldiers, when committed to a task, can't compromise. It's unrelenting devotion to the standards of duty and courage, absolute loyalty to others, not letting the task go until it's been done.
539.author: John Keegan

540.quote: Courage to be is the key to revelatory power of the feminist revolution.
540.author: Mary Daly

541.quote: Courage and perseverance have a magical talisman, before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish into air.
541.author: John Quincy Adams

542.quote: Overcoming the Cold War required courage from the people of Central and Eastern Europe and what was then the German Democratic Republic, but it also required the steadfastness of Western partner over many decades when many had long lost hope of integration of the two Germanys and Europe.
542.author: Angela Merkel

543.quote: Well, I think that - I think leadership's always been about two main things: imagination and courage.
543.author: Paul Keating

544.quote: There are always a few who stand up in times of communal madness and have the courage to say that what unites us is greater than what divides us.
544.author: Geraldine Brooks

545.quote: The preservation of peace and the guaranteeing of man's basic freedoms and rights require courage and eternal vigilance: courage to speak and act - and if necessary, to suffer and die - for truth and justice; eternal vigilance, that the least transgression of international morality shall not go undetected and unremedied.
545.author: Haile Selassie

546.quote: I can tell you character traits I admire and work to develop in myself - perseverance, self-discipline, courage to stand up for what is right even when it is against one's friends or one's self.
546.author: Dalia Mogahed
